bug.description:
üêõBug The shapes of the images of CT scans vary from images To reproduce Versions above 0.17.15 will have a different output if reading in .mhd or dicom folders print(torchio.__version__) subject = torchio.Subject( CT = torchio.Image(path = "something here", type=torchio.INTENSITY), ) print(subject.shape) ''' 0.17.10 (1, 512, 512, 345) '''
''' 0.17.18 (345, 1, 512, 512) '''
''' 0.17.14 (1, 512, 512, 345) '''
''' 0.17.15 (1, 512, 512, 345) '''
''' 0.17.17 (345, 1, 512, 512) ''' Expected behavior I expected the format in Channel x X x Y x Z but versions above 0.17.15 seem to follow a different format Not sure if this is a bug or a feature TorchIO version

comments.comment: Hi, <denchmark-link:https://github.com/DerpyCoder>@DerpyCoder</denchmark-link> . Thanks for reporting. Recent support for 4D images is probably causing this behavior. I don't know how your images are stored. Can you share some examples? You can change the way 4D images are read with the channels_last keyword argument of Image. By the way, you can now use ScalarImage and forget about type.

I directly pass the path to the image (mhd) or folder (dicom) in the path keyword argument. The dataset I am using to test this are the LUNA16 and the LIDC-IDRI dataset The dicom images are stored in a folder like 01.dcm 02.dcm 03.dcm The mhd files are in the same folder as their respective raw files Are these images counted as 4D images though since they only contain a channel

Changes in <denchmark-link:https://github.com/fepegar/torchio/commit/349d771ac58dc84afaa72fb39270472a95d857f5>349d771</denchmark-link> should have fixed this. Now, DICOM images are read with channels first by default so your results should be consistent in . Feel free to reopen if they're not.
